snippet: Summer Olympic sports carry their own particular vocabularies, and they seem to bring out the quadrennial linguist in all of us. In China, the official dictionary of Mandarin is also gettin' jiggy with some jargon of its own, from "house slaves" and...
abstract: Summer Olympic sports carry their own particular vocabularies, and they seem to bring out the quadrennial linguist in all of us. In China, the official dictionary of Mandarin is also gettin' jiggy with some jargon of its own, from "house slaves" and "banana person" to "diplomagate" and "NBA."

headline.main: An Olympian Effort: A Chinese Dictionary
